Package com.uttara.bhupendra.FilmyGyaan

Class MovieModelIO

java.lang.Object
com.uttara.bhupendra.FilmyGyaan.MovieModelIO
public class MovieModelIO
extends java.lang.Object
MovieModelIO implements different methods to perform different operations for the FilmyGyaan application.
Author:
Bhupendra Singh

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    MovieModelIO()
    Constructs a MovieModelIO object with no states.

    java.lang.String addMovie​(MovieBeanIO bean, java.lang.String listName)
    Appends the file specified by the abstract pathname which is specified by the name of the movie wish list with the MovieBeanIO instance.

    Checks if the file specified by the name of the wish list as abstract path already exists or not.

    Checks if the file specified by the name of the movie wish list exists, if not it creates a file in the specified directory.

    Deletes the file denoted by the pathname of the String passed.

    Checks whether the name of the movie exists in the file specified by the name of the list as abstract path.

    Returns a list of all the movie wish list names present in the specified directory.

    Returns an entry set of movie wish list name and list of MovieBeanIO objects from the specified directory.

    Return a set of MovieBeanIO objects in alphabetical order.

    Return a list of MovieBeanIO objects in descending order of rating.

    Returns a list of MovieBeanIO objects in ascending order of reviews.

    java.util.List<java.lang.String> showMovies​(java.lang.String listName)
    Returns a list of movie names in the file specified by the name of the list as abstract path by reading lines from the file and making MovieBeanIO objects.

  • Method Details

    • makeDirectory

      public boolean makeDirectory()
      Creates a directory on the desktop of the system.
      Returns:
      true if the directory is created, otherwise false.

    • duplicateName

      public boolean duplicateName​(java.lang.String listName, java.lang.String movieName)
      Checks whether the name of the movie exists in the file specified by the name of the list as abstract path.
      Parameters:
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      movieName - name of the movie(State of MovieBeanIO object).
      Returns:
      true if the movie name already exists in the file, false otherwise.

    • checkIfListExists

      public boolean checkIfListExists​(java.lang.String list)
      Checks if the file specified by the name of the wish list as abstract path already exists or not.
      Parameters:
      list - name of the movie wish list also specifies the abstract path.
      Returns:
      true if the file exits, and false otherwise.

    • checkIfMovieWishListExistsToCreate

      public boolean checkIfMovieWishListExistsToCreate​(java.lang.String list)
      Checks if the file specified by the name of the movie wish list exists, if not it creates a file in the specified directory.
      Parameters:
      list - name of the movie wish list also specifies the abstract path.
      Returns:
      true if the file exits, and false otherwise.

    • addMovie

      public java.lang.String addMovie​(MovieBeanIO bean, java.lang.String listName)
      Appends the file specified by the abstract pathname which is specified by the name of the movie wish list with the MovieBeanIO instance.
      Parameters:
      bean - object of type MovieBeanIO.
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      Returns:
      "success" if the object is successfully written to the file, otherwise, "File not found".

    • removeMovie

      public java.lang.String removeMovie​(java.lang.String listName, java.lang.String movieName)
      Removes the movie from the file specified by the list name as abstract path, if the movie exist in the file.
      Parameters:
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      movieName - movieName name of the movie(State of MovieBeanIO object).
      Returns:
      "success" if the movie is removed from the file, else "Movie is not available in the wish list" if the movie is not found in the list, otherwise, "File not found" if the file doesn't exist.

    • replaceMovieTitle

      public java.lang.String replaceMovieTitle​(java.lang.String oldMovie, java.lang.String newMovie, java.lang.String listName)
      Replaces the old movie name in the file specified by the list name as abstract path to new movie name, if the movie name exists in the file.
      Parameters:
      oldMovie - name of the movie to replace.
      newMovie - name of the movie to replace with.
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      Returns:
      "success" if the movie is replaced successfully, else "Movie doesn't exist." if the movie with oldMovie name is not there in the file, otherwise "File not found." if the file doesn't exist.

    • replaceDirectorTitle

      public java.lang.String replaceDirectorTitle​(java.lang.String movieName, java.lang.String newDirector, java.lang.String listName)
      Replaces the director name of the specified movie in the file specified by the list name as abstract path to new director name, if the movie name exists in the file.
      Parameters:
      movieName - name of the movie to get director name to replace.
      newDirector - name of the director to replace with.
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      Returns:
      "success" if the movie is replaced successfully, else "Movie doesn't exist." if the movie with oldMovie name is not there in the file, otherwise "File not found." if the file doesn't exist.

    • replaceProducerTitle

      public java.lang.String replaceProducerTitle​(java.lang.String movieName, java.lang.String newProducer, java.lang.String listName)
      Replaces the producer name of the specified movie in the file specified by the list name as abstract path to new producer name, if the movie name exists in the file.
      Parameters:
      movieName - name of the movie to get producer name to replace.
      newProducer - newDirector name of the producer to replace with.
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      Returns:
      "success" if the movie is replaced successfully, else "Movie doesn't exist." if the movie with oldMovie name is not there in the file, otherwise "File not found." if the file doesn't exist.

    • numOfOccurencesInTheList

      public int numOfOccurencesInTheList​(java.lang.String listName, java.lang.String word)
      Checks the number of occurrences of string in the file specified by the name of the movie list as abstract path.
      Parameters:
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      word - string whose occurrences are to be calculated.
      Returns:
      the number of occurrences of the string in the file if file exists, otherwise 0.

    • numOfOccurenceInMovieName

      public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> numOfOccurenceInMovieName​(java.lang.String listName, java.lang.String word)
      Checks the number of occurrences of the string in the movie names of the MovieBeanIO objects in the file specified by the movie wish list name as the abstract path.
      Parameters:
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      word - string whose occurrences are to be calculated
      Returns:
      A set of movie names in which the string is present, otherwise NULL.

      public int numOfOccurencesInMovies​(java.lang.String listName, java.lang.String word)
      Checks the number of occurrences of the string in the movie names of the MovieBeanIO objects in the file specified by the movie wish list name as the abstract path.
      Parameters:
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      word - string whose occurrences are to be calculated.
      Returns:
      the number of occurrences of the string in the file if file exists, otherwise 0.

    • numOfOccurenceInDirector

      public java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> numOfOccurenceInDirector​(java.lang.String listName, java.lang.String word)
      Checks the number of occurrences of the string in the director names of the MovieBeanIO objects in the file specified by the movie wish list name as the abstract path.
      Parameters:
      listName - name of the movie wish list.
      word - string whose occurrences are to be calculated.
      Returns:
      An entry set of movie names and director names after checking the names of director in which the string is present, otherwise NULL.

    • delete

      public java.lang.String delete​(java.lang.String listName)
      Deletes the file denoted by the pathname of the String passed. If the file exists in the directory then only it will be deleted.
      Parameters:
      listName - abstract pathname of the file.
      Returns:
      string if the deletion succeed or failed.
